summary: Canonical-correlation analysis (CCA) is a way of inferring information from cross-covariance matrices.
desc: <span class='help-method'>CCA Canonical Correlation Analysis.CCCA inherits from PLS with mode=”B” and deflation_mode=”canonical.
urlparagraph: Read more in the scikit-learn user guide.

tutorial.desc: Learn more on Oncoscape + Sci-Kit clustering methods

params.name: max_iter
params.desc: the maximum number of iterations of the NIPALS inner loop

params.name: tol
params.desc: the tolerance used in the iterative algorithm

params.name: copy
params.desc: whether the deflation be done on a copy. Let the default value to True unless you don’t care about side effects

attrs.name: n_iter
attrs.desc: number of iterations of the NIPALS inner loop for each component.

citations.name: A survey of Partial Least Squares (PLS) methods, with emphasis on the two-block case.
citations.desc: Jacob A. Wegelin. A survey of Partial Least Squares (PLS) methods, with emphasis on the two-block case. Technical Report 371, Department of Statistics, University of Washington, Seattle, 2000.

citations.name: La regression PLS: theorie et pratique
citations.desc: Tenenhaus, M. (1998). La regression PLS: theorie et pratique. Paris: Editions Technic.
